job description:
Sr. Machine Learning Engineer
If you are a Sr. Machine Learning / Computer Vision Engineer with solid working experience, please read on!

Located right next to Pike's Place Market, in Seattle, WA, we are a big name online marketplace for real estate and rental properties that is seeing wild success and actively expanding our business. We are taking on several new initiatives that are going to further our current business, as well as expand into new and emerging markets. We have hundreds of millions of properties in our database and we know how to effectively use them to aid individuals in the home buying, renting, financing, and more. we are now creating highly personalized content using machine learning and big data techniques that are going to revolutionize the process.
What You Will Be Doing
- Build highly parallelized, big data, machine-learning applications in the cloud.
- Lead a strong team of data scientists, engineers, and analysts.
- Design and code highly scalable, machine learning applications processing large volumes of data.
- Collaborate with other data scientists and machine learning engineers.
- Follow agile processes.
- Be a part of the entire product development lifestyle.
- QA and Defect resolution
What You Need for this Position
- 5+ years working experience
- Proficient with either: Python, Spark, Scala, C++ or R
- Computer Vision / Machine Learning
- Hadoop ecosystem (Mapreduce, Yarn, HDFS, Pig, etc.) would be a huge bonus
- Either: AWS / Azure / Google Cloud

Nice to have:
- SLAM
- OpenCV
What's In It for You
- Highly Competitive Salary
- Generous Vacation / PTO
- Medical / Dental / Vision
- Commuter Subsidies
- Maternity / Parental Leave
- Bonus
- 401k (4% match)
So, if you are a Sr. Machine Learning Engineer with experience, please apply today!
-

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.



CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
